Module sce.sc2002.FinalProject
Package sce.sc2002.FinalProject

Class Login

java.lang.Object
sce.sc2002.FinalProject.Login
public class Login extends Object
When the program started it require the instance of this class to run to create a login option
Since:
11/2/2023
Version:
1.0
Author:
Nguyen Tuan

    readPassword()
    This method will mask the password and do not let the user or other parties see the input password if the program runs outside the IDLE.
    (i.e when the program runs on the system terminal or console)
    private void
    validate(String input_userid, String input_password, Scanner csvFile)
    This method will validate the input userid and input password by comparing:
    - The userid created from the email (the part before '@') retrieved from csv file.
    - The password in the data retreived from csv file.
    If the user's is valid, all the appropriate variable in this class will update.
    private void
    validateControl(String input_userid, String input_password)
    This method control the flow of validating by calling validate() method

    • getDataFromCSV

      private Scanner getDataFromCSV(String role)
      This method will base on the role parameter. Then, it will find and return the appropriate user list with all the users' data needed.
      Parameters:
      role - The role of the users in the csv this method will retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Scanner instance that have the data of the required csv file.
      See Also:
      • validateControl(String, String)

    • readPassword

      private String readPassword()
      This method will mask the password and do not let the user or other parties see the input password if the program runs outside the IDLE.
      (i.e when the program runs on the system terminal or console)
      Returns:
      password.
      See Also:
      • display()

    • validate

      private void validate(String input_userid, String input_password, Scanner csvFile)
      This method will validate the input userid and input password by comparing:
      - The userid created from the email (the part before '@') retrieved from csv file.
      - The password in the data retreived from csv file.
      If the user's is valid, all the appropriate variable in this class will update.
      Parameters:
      input_userid - userid from user's input
      input_password - password from user's input
      csvFile - Scanner object that point to the csv file used to check the user's validation.
      See Also:
      • validateControl(String, String)
      • userid
      • password
      • name
      • email
      • faculty

    • validateControl

      private void validateControl(String input_userid, String input_password)
      This method control the flow of validating by calling validate() method
      Parameters:
      input_userid - userid from user's input
      input_password - password from user's input

    • display

      public void display()
      This method will control the flow of the login system. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
